intro: Carum appuanum subsp. bulgaricum, commonly known as the Balkan caraway, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, carroty scent when crushed. This subspecies is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
